title: Lululemon Stock Falls as Omicron Hits Holiday Sales
sub_head: The athletic-apparel maker said fourth-quarter results will be toward the low end of previous estimates
body:
Shares of Lululemon Athletica Inc. fell Monday morning after the activewear maker said it expects sales and earnings from the holiday quarter to come in near the low end of its previous forecasts amid renewed Covid-19 challenges.
The Omicron variant constrained capacity, disrupted staffing and led to reduced operating hours in some places last month, Lululemon Chief Executive Calvin McDonald said. Those trends have weighed on sales and earnings in the November-through-January quarter, according to the company.
